subject: Public Speaking
title: Aboriginal Songlines
description: A short lesson to help you apply Aboriginal Songlines.

hook.text: Australian Aboriginal songlines map the continent through oral narrative.

buildup.text: Stories carry navigation, law, and ecology across 65,000 years.

discovery.text: Singing the land is a speech form that Western categories miss.

twist.text: Songlines prove oratory can serve functions beyond persuasion.

climax.text: The oldest continuous oral tradition on Earth is speech as map.

punchline.text: Speech can map worlds. Aboriginal culture proves it.

quiz.question: What are songlines?
options: Oral narratives that map land and law
